API Reference

This is the API reference for the picowide CircuitPython project.

Main Application (code.py)

Main CircuitPython application
  1"""
  2Picowide - Raspberry Pi Pico 2 W Web-based Development Environment
  3
  4This module creates a WiFi hotspot and serves a web-based file editor interface
  5for developing directly on the Pico 2 W. It provides a complete IDE accessible
  6from any device connected to the Pico's WiFi network.
  7
  8Core Features:
  9    - WiFi Access Point creation
 10    - Web-based file manager with CRUD operations
 11    - Real-time file editing through browser interface
 12    - Mobile-friendly responsive design
 13
 14Technical Implementation:
 15    - Backend: CircuitPython with adafruit_httpserver
 16    - Frontend: Vanilla HTML/CSS/JavaScript
 17    - Access: Connect to "Picowide" WiFi → Navigate to 192.168.4.1
 18
 19Author: Picowide Project
 20Version: 1.09 (Modified for FOSS release - with password)
 21License: MIT
 22"""
 23
 24import wifi
 25import socketpool
 26import ipaddress
 27import os
 28import board
 29import digitalio
 30import time
 31from adafruit_httpserver import Server, Request, Response
 32import gc # Added for memory management
 33
 34# --- NEW: Config Import ---
 35try:
 36    import config
 37except ImportError:
 38    print("config.py not found. Using default values for power saving.")
 39    class Config:
 40        WIFI_AP_TIMEOUT_MINUTES = 10  # Default timeout in minutes if config.py is missing
 41    config = Config()

 43# =============================================================================
 44# CORE SYSTEM SETUP

 47# Create WiFi hotspot with a password
 48# For community release, this password should be clearly documented and/or changeable.
 49# For security in deployment, use a strong, unique password.
 50wifi.radio.start_ap(ssid="Picowide", password="simpletest")
 51wifi.radio.set_ipv4_address_ap(
 52    ipv4=ipaddress.IPv4Address("192.168.4.1"),
 53    netmask=ipaddress.IPv4Address("255.255.255.0"),
 54    gateway=ipaddress.IPv4Address("192.168.4.1")
 55)
 56
 57# Initialize server
 58pool = socketpool.SocketPool(wifi.radio)
 59server = Server(pool, "/", debug=False)

 61# --- NEW/MODIFIED: WiFi Timeout Variables and Activity Tracker ---
 62last_activity_time = time.monotonic()
 63WIFI_TIMEOUT_SECONDS = config.WIFI_AP_TIMEOUT_MINUTES * 60
 64last_timeout_check_log_time = time.monotonic() # For periodic + logging
 65ap_is_off_and_logged = False # NEW: Flag to prevent repeated shutdown messages after AP is off
 66timeout_disabled = False # NEW: Flag to disable automatic timeout when user takes control
 67
 68def update_activity_time():
 69   """
 70   Updates the global timestamp for the last detected user activity.
 71   Called by every web server route to reset the Wi-Fi timeout.
 72   """
 73   global last_activity_time, ap_is_off_and_logged
 74   # Only reset if Wi-Fi is still active. Avoid logging if already shut down.
 75   if wifi.radio.enabled:
 76       last_activity_time = time.monotonic()
 77       ap_is_off_and_logged = False # Reset flag when activity detected and AP is on (i.e., AP is now working)
 78       # console_print(f"Activity detected, timer reset. (Elapsed: {round(time.monotonic() - last_activity_time, 1)}s / Timeout: {WIFI_TIMEOUT_SECONDS}s)")
 79
 80def shut_down_wifi_and_sleep(sleep_duration=None):
 81    """
 82    Shuts down the Wi-Fi Access Point and optionally puts the board to sleep.
 83    If sleep_duration is None, it means a permanent low-power state requiring
 84    a physical power cycle to restart the hotspot.
 85    """
 86    # This function now assumes the caller (check_wifi_timeout or power_save_mode)
 87    # has determined that a shutdown is needed and not already logged.
 88    console_print("Initiating Wi-Fi shutdown and power saving mode...")
 89    if wifi.radio.enabled: # Only call stop_ap if it's currently enabled
 90        wifi.radio.stop_ap()
 91        console_print("Wi-Fi AP shut down.")
 92    else:
 93        # This branch should ideally not be hit if ap_is_off_and_logged logic works,
 94        # but kept for robustness.
 95        console_print("Wi-Fi AP already off (or never started).")
 96
 97    # MODIFIED: Remove sleep functionality to allow other Pico operations to continue
 98    if sleep_duration is not None:
 99        console_print(f"Light sleep disabled - Pico continues other operations.")
100    else:
101        console_print("Wi-Fi shutdown complete. Other Pico operations continue. Requires physical power cycle to restart hotspot.")
102
103
104def check_wifi_timeout():
105    """
106    Checks if the Wi-Fi AP has timed out due to inactivity and shuts it down.
107    Provides periodic console output only when AP is active.
108    """
109    global last_activity_time, last_timeout_check_log_time, ap_is_off_and_logged, timeout_disabled
110    
111    # NEW: Skip timeout logic entirely if user has disabled automatic timeout
112    if timeout_disabled:
113        return
114    
115    current_time = time.monotonic()
116
117    # If Wi-Fi AP is currently enabled
118    if wifi.radio.enabled:
119        # Log periodic checks every few seconds
120        if (current_time - last_timeout_check_log_time >= min(10, WIFI_TIMEOUT_SECONDS / 2 if WIFI_TIMEOUT_SECONDS > 20 else 1)):
121            elapsed_time = round(current_time - last_activity_time, 1)
122            remaining_time = round(WIFI_TIMEOUT_SECONDS - elapsed_time, 1)
123            console_print(f"Wi-Fi AP active. Inactivity: {elapsed_time}s / Remaining: {remaining_time}s")
124            last_timeout_check_log_time = current_time
125
126        # Check if timeout has occurred AND we haven't already logged the shutdown for this state
127        if (current_time - last_activity_time > WIFI_TIMEOUT_SECONDS) and not ap_is_off_and_logged:
128            console_print(f"--- Wi-Fi AP timed out after {config.WIFI_AP_TIMEOUT_MINUTES} minutes of inactivity. ---")
129            shut_down_wifi_and_sleep() # Call the common shutdown function
130            ap_is_off_and_logged = True # IMPORTANT: Set flag AFTER shutdown is triggered and logged
131    elif not wifi.radio.enabled and not ap_is_off_and_logged:
132        # This branch ensures that if the AP was manually turned off,
133        # or if the board started without AP enabled, it logs its status once.
134        # However, for our timeout/button case, ap_is_off_and_logged will be set to True
135        # by the shutdown process, so this specific block will mostly serve
136        # if there's a unique unlogged "AP off" state.
137        console_print("Wi-Fi AP is currently off (and status not yet logged this cycle).")
138        ap_is_off_and_logged = True
139

150# Setup LED
151led = digitalio.DigitalInOut(board.LED)

154# Blink timing
155last_blink = time.monotonic()
156led_state = False
157blinky_enabled = False

163def console_print(message):
164    """
165    Add a message to the console buffer for web monitoring.
166    
167    :param str message: Message to add to console output
168    :return: None
169    :rtype: None
170    """
171    global console_buffer
172    # Always print to serial console for debugging purposes
173    print(f"[PicoWide]: {message}") 
174    if monitor_enabled:
175        console_buffer.append(message)
176        # Keep buffer size manageable
177        if len(console_buffer) > 100:
178            console_buffer = console_buffer[-50:]
179
180def update_blinky():
181    """
182    Update the LED blinky state based on timing interval.
183    
184    This function manages the onboard LED blinking pattern by checking
185    if enough time has elapsed since the last blink and toggling the
186    LED state accordingly. Only blinks when blinky_enabled is True.
187    Called from the main loop.
188    
189    Global Variables:
190        last_blink (float): Timestamp of last LED state change
191        led_state (bool): Current LED state (True=on, False=off)
192        blinky_enabled (bool): Whether blinking is currently active
193        BLINK_INTERVAL (float): Time between blinks in seconds
194    
195    :return: None
196    :rtype: None
197    """
198    global last_blink, led_state
199    
200    if not blinky_enabled:
201        led.value = False  # Ensure LED is off when blinky is disabled
202        return
203        
204    current_time = time.monotonic()
205    
206    if current_time - last_blink >= BLINK_INTERVAL:
207        led_state = not led_state
208        led.value = led_state
209        last_blink = current_time
210        
211        # Add console output for monitoring
212        status = "LED ON" if led_state else "LED OFF"
213        #console_print(status) # Uncomment to show each on/off cycle on the console
214        # console_print(status) # Removed to avoid spamming console during timeout test

283# --- NEW: Hotspot Control Route ---
284@server.route("/toggle-hotspot-control", methods=["POST"])
285def toggle_hotspot_control(request: Request):
286   """
287   Handles requests to toggle between keeping hotspot open and immediate shutdown.
288   When timeout is disabled, provides immediate shutdown option.
289   When timeout is enabled, disables timeout and keeps hotspot open.
290   """
291   global timeout_disabled, ap_is_off_and_logged
292   update_activity_time() # Update activity on hotspot control toggle
293   
294   if not timeout_disabled:
295       # User wants to keep hotspot open (disable timeout)
296       timeout_disabled = True
297       console_print("Automatic timeout disabled. Hotspot will remain open until manually closed.")
298       return Response(request, "Close Hotspot", content_type="text/plain")
299   else:
300       # User wants to close hotspot immediately
301       console_print("Received request to close hotspot immediately.")
302       shut_down_wifi_and_sleep()
303       ap_is_off_and_logged = True
304       return Response(request, "Hotspot closed. Physical power cycle needed to restart.", content_type="text/plain")
305# --- LEGACY: Power Save Route (kept for compatibility) ---
306@server.route("/power-save", methods=["POST"])
307def power_save_mode(request: Request):
308    """
309    Handles requests to enter power-saving mode.
310    Shuts down Wi-Fi AP and signals a permanent low-power state.
311    Requires a physical power cycle to restart the hotspot.
312    """
313    global ap_is_off_and_logged
314    # No need to update activity time here, as we are intentionally shutting down.
315    if not ap_is_off_and_logged: # Only log manual shutdown once
316        console_print("Received request to enter power-save mode.")
317        shut_down_wifi_and_sleep()
318        ap_is_off_and_logged = True # Set flag after manual shutdown is triggered and logged
319    return Response(request, "Power saving mode activated. Wi-Fi AP shut down. Physical power cycle needed to restart.", content_type="text/plain")

327def list_all_files():
328    """
329    List all files in the CIRCUITPY root directory.
330    
331    This function scans the root filesystem and returns a list of all
332    files and directories present. It handles OSError exceptions that
333    may occur during filesystem access.
334    
335    :return: List of filenames found in root directory
336    :rtype: list[str]
337    
338    Example:
339        >>> files = list_all_files()
340        >>> print(files)
341        ['code.py', 'index.html', 'styles.css', 'secrets.py']
342    """
343    files = []
344    try:
345        for file in os.listdir("/"):
346            files.append(file)
347    except OSError:
348        pass
349    return files
350
351def get_file_info(filename):
352    """
353    Get detailed information about a specific file.
354    
355    :param str filename: Name of the file to inspect
356    :return: Dictionary containing file information or None if file doesn't exist
357    :rtype: dict or None
358    
359    Example:
360        >>> info = get_file_info("code.py")
361        >>> print(info)
362        {'name': 'code.py', 'size': 1234, 'type': 'file'}
363    """
364    try:
365        stat = os.stat(filename)
366        return {
367            "name": filename,
368            "size": stat[6],  # st_size
369            "type": "directory" if stat[0] & 0x4000 else "file"
370        }
371    except OSError:
372        return None
373
374@server.route("/list-files", methods=["POST"])
375def list_files(request: Request):
376    """
377    Handle file listing requests from the web interface.
378    
379    This route processes POST requests to list all files in the root
380    directory. It formats the response as a plain text list suitable
381    for parsing by the JavaScript frontend.
382    
383    :param Request request: The HTTP request object
384    :return: Plain text response with file listing
385    :rtype: Response
386    
387    Response Format:
388        Files found:
389        
390        filename1.py
391        filename2.html
392        filename3.css
393    """
394    update_activity_time() # NEW: Update activity on file list request
395    print("Handling list files request")
396    all_files = list_all_files()
397    
398    if all_files:
399        # Format files as a single column, one per line
400        file_list = "\n".join(all_files)
401        response_body = f"Files found:\n\n{file_list}"
402    else:
403        response_body = "No files found in CIRCUITPY root directory."
404    
405    return Response(request, response_body, content_type="text/plain")

434@server.route("/open-file", methods=["POST"])
435def open_file(request: Request):
436    """
437    Handle file opening requests for editing.
438    
439    This route reads the contents of a specified file and returns it
440    for display in the web-based editor. It handles file reading errors
441    gracefully and provides appropriate error messages.
442    
443    :param Request request: The HTTP request object containing form data
444    :return: File contents formatted for editor or error message
445    :rtype: Response
446    
447    Form Data Expected:
448        - filename: Name of the file to open
449        
450    Response Format:
451        File: filename.py
452        
453        [file contents here]
454    """
455    update_activity_time() # NEW: Update activity on file open
456    try:
457        # Get the filename from form data
458        filename = request.form_data.get('filename', '')
459        if filename:
460            # Read the file content
461            try:
462                with open(filename, 'r') as f:
463                    content = f.read()
464                return Response(request, f"File: {filename}\n\n{content}", content_type="text/plain")
465            except OSError:
466                return Response(request, f"Error: Could not read file '{filename}'", content_type="text/plain")
467        else:
468            return Response(request, "No file specified", content_type="text/plain")
469    except Exception as e:
470        print(f"Error in open_file: {e}")
471        return Response(request, f"Error: {str(e)}", content_type="text/plain")

522@server.route("/create-file", methods=["POST"])
523def create_file(request: Request):
524    """
525    Handle file creation requests.
526    
527    This route creates a new empty file with the specified name on the
528    filesystem. It checks for existing files to prevent overwriting.
529    
530    :param Request request: The HTTP request object containing form data
531    :return: Success confirmation or error message
532    :rtype: Response
533    
534    Form Data Expected:
535        - filename: Name of the new file to create
536    """
537    update_activity_time() # NEW: Update activity on file creation
538    try:
539        filename = request.form_data.get('filename', '')
540        
541        if not filename:
542            return Response(request, "No filename specified", content_type="text/plain")
543        
544        # Check if file already exists
545        try:
546            with open(filename, 'r'):
547                return Response(request, f"Error: File '{filename}' already exists", content_type="text/plain")
548        except OSError:
549            # File doesn't exist, create it
550            try:
551                with open(filename, 'w') as f:
552                    f.write('')  # Create empty file
553                return Response(request, f"File '{filename}' created successfully!", content_type="text/plain")
554            except OSError as e:
555                return Response(request, f"Error: Could not create file '{filename}' - {str(e)}", content_type="text/plain")
556                
557    except Exception as e:
558        print(f"Error in create_file: {e}")
559        return Response(request, f"Error: {str(e)}", content_type="text/plain")
560

582        else:

584    except Exception as e:

614# =============================================================================
615# SERVER STARTUP AND MAIN LOOP
616# =============================================================================
617
618# Start the server
619server.start("192.168.4.1", port=80)
620print("Picowide ready at http://192.168.4.1")
621console_print(f"Wi-Fi AP timeout set to {config.WIFI_AP_TIMEOUT_MINUTES} minutes ({WIFI_TIMEOUT_SECONDS} seconds).")
622
623
624# Main server loop
625while True:
626    """
627    Main server polling loop.
628    
629    This loop continuously polls the server for incoming requests and
630    handles them appropriately. It also updates the LED blinky state
631    on each iteration. Runs indefinitely until the device is reset
632    or powered off.
633    
634    Note:
635        This is a blocking loop that will consume the main thread.
636        Any additional background tasks should be integrated here
637        or handled via interrupts.
638    """
639    server.poll()
640    
641    # Update blinky LED state
642    update_blinky()
643    
644    # NEW: Check Wi-Fi timeout periodically and log progress
645    check_wifi_timeout()
646    
647    # NEW: Add a small delay and garbage collection for stability
648    time.sleep(0.1) # Prevents busy-waiting and allows some time for other tasks
649    gc.collect() # Periodically run garbage collection
